caption: This place is the best one to get nice photographs clicked for Instagram or for portfolios. This place is very hard to find if you are taking subway or metro or even walking. I was fortunate enough to somehow find it but it’s worth visiting this place. There is no entry fee so not to worry. There are loads of stores and restaurants and cafes to shop, eat and drink.

To get away from the hustle and the bustle, this has become our sanctuary, the architecture is simply stunning, the gardens are beautiful, a wonderful place to have a picnic lunch,  it is easy to spend a couple of hours here.

Domaine National du Palais-Royal is an absolutely beautiful place to visit in Paris! The gardens and architecture are stunning, offering a peaceful retreat right in the heart of the city. Best of all, it’s free to enter, making it a perfect spot for anyone looking to enjoy some of Paris’s charm without spending a dime.  The entire area is incredibly photogenic, with elegant columns, manicured gardens, and lovely fountains that create a picturesque setting. It’s a great place for a leisurely stroll, taking photos, or just sitting on a bench and soaking in the atmosphere.  For travelers planning a visit, I recommend going early in the morning or late in the afternoon to enjoy the serenity of the gardens before they get too busy. If you’re into photography, you’ll find plenty of opportunities for beautiful shots, especially with the iconic black and white columns in the courtyard. Also, take some time to explore the surrounding area, as there are plenty of charming cafes and boutiques nearby.  Overall, Domaine National du Palais-Royal is a must-visit when in Paris—it’s a hidden gem that offers a perfect blend of history, beauty, and tranquility. Don’t miss it!
Only visited the exterior quickly.  Lovely courtyard with trees, fun pillars to climb on and take photos. Covered walkways with shops and food.  Free!

What a great place to relax on the middle of a busy Paris. Gardens are stunning and it’s not too busy. Free to enter and just hang out. The fountains are a tribute to Champagne because that’s where it was first made public by the Monk Dom Perignon.

Magnificent site. I lived in Paris for decades and I did not know this place. It was only when I returned to Paris this fall that I had time to stroll around and discover this place. Magnificent and impressive. Try not to miss it.

I visited this place after my completing  Louvre visit as it is close to Louvre. Palais Royale is very good for photography. A must visit place for instagramners. The striped columns in different sizes are a unique attraction. The adjacent garden is also very nice with beautiful colourful flowers. This place is completely free and there is no ticket required.

Simply spectacular and within easy walking distance of numerous iconic "must see" places in Paris.  The spacious and well kept grounds are a real treat where you can relax or browse and take in the atmosphere at your leisure.  Definitely well worth the visit.  No cost to enter.  Take the obligatory photo as a momento of your visit.
Pretty location for photos and relaxation. Lots of chairs available in the garden and plants are well managed.

This is one of my favourite spots in Paris, without a doubt. The elegant beauty, history and exquisite refinement of this place always recharges me. I love reading the thoughtful quotes written on the benches and chairs and just spending time in contemplation and gratitude. An oasis of enriching tranquility in the heart of the most beautiful city in the world.

The Domaine National du Palais-Royal is a stunning historical and cultural landmark in Paris, offering a blend of classical architecture, art, and serene gardens. Originally built for Cardinal Richelieu in the 17th century, the site now hosts the Ministry of Culture and the Conseil d'État. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls through its beautifully manicured gardens, appreciate the iconic contemporary art installations by Daniel Buren, and explore the elegant arcades housing charming boutiques and cafes. It’s a perfect spot for both history enthusiasts and those seeking a peaceful retreat in the heart of the city.
Spend some quality time walking through shopping center , the garden next to it and shopping eating around

Strategic and accessible place or parc in heart of Paris city. It’s free to enter and rare, unique and interesting place to visit. Garden family and kids friendly. And nearby or walking distance to/from many historical sites or touristy objects.
Great place to wonder about. Check out the architecture, browse nearby shops/cafés/restaurants and or just people watch
Plenty of locals come here to relax.. some interesting facts about this.. i think good place to visit

This beautiful garden is a must-see for anyone visiting Paris. It is so calm and peaceful, despite the number of people who frequent it. It is particularly popular for picnics. Most benches have quotes on them from great French writers. You may also recognise it from Taylor Swift's Begin Again or season 1 of Emily in Paris.
Cool place to visit while near the Louvre museum. Columns for photshooting and nearby garden to enjoy the greenery.

A square full of life, people are dancing in a corner and others are getting married, chairs in the garden for people to read and enjoy nature and observing the surroundings. Has a very special atmosphere
Very interesting architecture. Small square with different columns in the yard of the Ministry of Culture. I find it very peaceful, interesting, unusual, different. Highly recommend.
Wide open space with a very neat visual. In the warmer season events are held here like fashion shows. Beautiful for a stroll, photo oops or just a cut through while walking the city.
The perspective is even more impressive when you enter from one of the side doors, and the courtyard will just become magnified as you enter. Try to do a pistol on one of the pillars lol
Simple narrow park-ie, nice place to sit around while inbetween visiting other attractions. A bit dull in the winter, quite a bit of trash.

The Palais Royal gardens offer a tranquil oasis amidst the bustling city, where visitors can stroll amidst lush greenery, admire the sculpted hedges, and marvel at the stunning fountains. It’s a serene escape from the urban hustle, perfect for quiet reflection or a leisurely picnic.

Nice little garden and courtyard to wander around, and see the interesting striped column design. It appears to be the courtyard of some sort of palace, or ex-government building. The garden is definitely worth spending a lot of time in.

Nice area encompassing the Public Square, gardens and building of the Palais Royal… plenty of history in the place and so many nice shops and cafes to explore. In the spring and summer the gardens are a lovely place to chill out, especially by the fountain, and the inner courtyard with the black and white sculptures make for a great opportunity. There’s a Metro stop just opposite by the Louvre, with the lines 1 & 7. Close to other attractions like the Opera and Louvre, with the Tuileries gardens and also close to the river Seine…

A real hidden gem behind the Louvres. Not as crowded as the Tuilleries and definitely smaller. I always enjoy it on a beautiful sunny day when in town. You can also sip a coffee in one of the coffee shops surrounding it.
Amazing Palace to walk around and enjoy the day, really cool architecture where you can take a lot of pictures all around.
I can sit in the garden for hours and enjoy the peace and calm.  The flowers and fountains are spectacular.  This a great place to get away from the tourists and relax on garden benches and chairs.

This was cool to see.. the courtyard just to the left of this is one often seen from the series Emily in Paris, which is just cool to see the benches and area you see often in the show. 😊 other places seen in the series is also close by! Many of the shops here were closed. …

Totally found this place by accident.  But so cool.  The park  and surrounding areas are so nice. The center court with all the raised columns is cool . If you are limber enough to get one the taller ones it makes for some great pictures . Then when you leave the eara you come out at the side of the Louvre.  Which is kinda neat.
Love this place! So relaxed and chilled. You can just lay and sit here all day with a good book or something. There's a cafe close by and you can also walk around to take great pictures.

This place is like taking you back into the past world of glorious living, with huge gardens and courtyards of royals now opened and accessible to the public. Paris has such a well preserved culture and history, and one must take time to soak it all in.

This place is small but in my opinion the nicest garden in all of Paris. The way it is enclosed by palatial buildings, and the comfortable seats around the fountain make for a peaceful break from the crowded streets. See the photos for yourself.

A wonderful small park with a fountain in the middle surrounded by gorgeous buildings. The perfect breathing space in the middle of the city. A must every time I'm in Paris. Enjoy the photo options at your own risk.
Perfect place to chill and relax

Built for Cardinal Richelieu by the architect Lemercier, builder of the Sorbonne, the main building (1634), facing the Louvre, became a royal residence (regency of Anne of Austria) and then for the Orléans family from 1661. The work was completed and redesigned in the two centuries The eighteenth and nineteenth. The three wings closing the sides of the garden date from the end of the 18th century.
An amusing place to take photos. The park is quite tranquil and around it there are lots of bars and restaurants. Nice to spend an afternoon of relax.
Amazing garden, luxury shops around under the arcades. The magnolias are beautiful in their flowers if you can catch the right time of the year. Walk around, sit a bit, enjoy the life.
